tool.name: Finding CTCF motifs

param.name: genomeID
param.label: Genome: hg19 supported by default. For other genome assemblies, provide a custom_global_motif_list in FIMO format.

param.name: bed_file_dir
param.label: File path to a directory (e.g. ) which contains two folders: unique and inferred. These folders should contain a combination of RAD21, SMC3, and CTCF BED files. By intersecting these 1D tracks, the strongest peaks will be identified. Unique motifs generally use a more stringent combination of BED files than inferred motifs.

param.name: looplist
param.label: List of peaks in standard 2D feature format (chr1 x1 x2 chr2 y1 y2 color ...)

param.name: custom_global_motif_list
param.label: Motif list output using FIMO format can be used as an alternative to the internal motif list

tool.help:
motifs <genomeID> <bed_file_dir> <looplist> [custom_global_motif_list]
The required arguments are:
<genomeID>: hg19 supported by default. For other genome assemblies, provide a custom_global_motif_list in FIMO format.
<bed_file_dir> File path to a directory (e.g. ) which contains two folders: "unique" and "inferred". These folders should contain a combination of RAD21, SMC3, and CTCF BED files. By intersecting these 1D tracks, the strongest peaks will be identified. Unique motifs generally use a more stringent combination of BED files than inferred motifs.
<looplist>: List of peaks in standard 2D feature format (chr1 x1 x2 chr2 y1 y2 color ...)
-- NOTE -- If you want to use a custom list of potential motifs:
[custom_global_motif_list]: Motif list output using FIMO format can be used as an alternative to the internal motif list
